{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3483814,"name":"Gerardo","username":"jerry.origin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jerry.origin/{size}/253430_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T21:58:06.370Z","cooked":"

We made the design for a single stage elevator but we found out we might need to make a two stage elevator since we are looking to reach Level 4 of the Reef. How does a 2 Stage Elevator work in contrast to a single stage?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T21:58:06.370Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":208,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":1085.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481965,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-a-2-stage-elevator","display_username":"Gerardo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66640,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-a-2-stage-elevator/481965/1","custom_user_title":"Lead Programmer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3483821,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T22:02:27.174Z","cooked":"

There are many many threads on this topic already, worth a search.

"Perpendicular" vs "Parallel" Elevator Discussion Technical
One of the debates I have had with both other teams and team members is how to go about mechanism mounting in a 3-stage elevator with carriage. The question is whether to score through or over or coming perpendicularly off of the elevator, like the WCP CC and the RUSTHounds Ri3D design and many others, or alongside it, parallel to the elevator (examples are escaping me at the moment). Weighing the two in a decision matrix, they both have their own advantages, and I was curious to hear what other…
FRC Elevator Designs (Powered Return To Floor) Technical
Hello, for an offseason project our team built an elevator. It works ok however it’s a little heavy using a #35 chain to both lift the carriage and the second stage. The biggest issue we have with it is that when descending quickly the chain can slack and the carriage can return a bit too slow for fast cycle times if this were going to be used in a competition. Currently we are only using a #35 chain attached to the mock chassis to lift the carriage and a single sprocket at the top. It uses only…
Feedback on Elevator Design Technical Discussion
The difficult parts in this elevator are the chain-to-tube mounts and the bearing blocks. The trouble is, TTB is sold out of the bearing blocks. Edit: SDS isn’t sold out of their elevator bearing kits; they have a 5-day lead time, though. These are probably better than the old VEX stuff. Deprecated Pulleys for the second stage should be obtainable, or 3D printable. You don’t necessarily need forks like The Thrifty Elevator uses; the pulleys can be set with their axle bolts through the tube…
How can we calculate gearing ratio for elevator Technical
I was thinking that 1:20 reduction would work, but are there any other ways to calculate this ratio. We want a fast elevator
